Legal_Issue: Whether the RAD's decision to review the RPD's findings on a reasonableness standard was reasonable
Application_Facts: Ms. Brodrick claimed refugee protection due to domestic abuse in Nigeria
Decision_Outcome: RPD and RAD rejected the claim
Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review was allowed
Procedural_Issue: RAD's use of reasonableness standard rendered Federal Court's role duplicative
Legal_Provision_Cited: Provisions of IRPA regarding review standards
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution due to domestic violence
Relief_Sought: Remittal to a new RAD panel for reconsideration
Governing_Rule: Federal Court reviews RAD decisions on reasonableness unless correctness is required by law
Outcome: Case remitted to a new RAD panel for reconsideration
Decisional_Body: Refugee Appeal Division (RAD), Refugee Protection Division (RPD)
Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm due to domestic abuse in country of origin
Cause_Description: Ms. Brodrick claimed refugee protection based on gender-based persecution through domestic abuse in Nigeria
Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA provisions on appropriate review standards
Legal_Provision: Sections of IRPA governing RAD review standards
Jurisdictional_Issue: Proper scope of RAD's review authority under IRPA
Decision_Rationale: RAD's use of reasonableness standard was unreasonable as it undermined Federal Court's role and contradicted statutory framework
